Title:
Three novel species of Distoseptispora from Jiangxi province
of China
Keywords:
Hyphomycete, three new taxon, Distoseptispora,
phylogenetic analysis, taxonomy
Abstract:
Three new Distoseptispora species, D. yunjushanensis, D.
yongxiuensis and D. meilingensis from submerged dead bamboo culm in
Jiangxi Province, China, are described and illustrated. Distoseptispora
yunjushanensis is characterized by macronematous, mononematous, septate,
unbranched conidiophores with monoblastic, integrated, determinate,
terminal conidiogenous cells that produce acrogenous, solitary,
obclavate, distoseptate conidia. Distoseptispora yongxiuensis is
characterized by macronematous, mononematous, septate, unbranched
conidiophores with monoblastic, integrated, determinate, terminal
conidiogenous cells that produce acrogenous, solitary, obclavate,
distoseptate conidia. Distoseptispora meilingensis is characterized by
macronematous, mononematous, septate, unbranched conidiophores with
monoblastic, integrated, determinate, terminal conidiogenous cells that
produce acrogenous, solitary, obclavate, distoseptate conidia.
ITS-LSU-SSU-tef1 sequence analyses were used to infer the phylogenetic
relationship between D. yunjushanensis, D. yongxiuensis, D.meilingensis
and related species. Both molecular analyses and morphological data well
support D. yunjushanensis, D. yongxiuensis and D. meilingensis as three
independent taxa.
